LineItemTitle.val: Hvy Expanded Mobile Tactical Truck Ext Serv

Description.val:
The Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck Extended Service Program (HEMTT-ESP) is a Recapitalization program critical to upgrading the 11 Ton payload, 8 wheel drive HEMTT to include armor ready capability as well as modernizing the aging fleet. The HEMTT-ESP remanufactures and upgrades 20+ year old HEMTT A0 vehicles and HEMTT A2 vehicles to the current A4 configuration. The HEMTT A4 has improved survivability with integrated under body A-Cab and a scalable B-Kit (common to the Palletized Load System (PLSA1)); a modern powertrain; upgraded suspension and electrical system and incorporates an anti-lock brake system, air conditioning and traction control as standard on the platform. The HEMTT fleet is an essential combat enabler in all Brigade Combat Team (BCT) formations. This program produces a like-new vehicle with a full new vehicle warranty.

Approved Acquisition Objective (AAO) for HEMTT ESP is incorporated with HEMTT new at 20,369.

Justification.val:
FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $31.892 million supports the recapitalization of a total of 53 HEMTT variants to the latest A4 configuration in support of Direct Army and Army Prepositioned Stock (APS).

FY 2019 OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $6.682 million supports the recapitalization of a total of 11 HEMTT M983A4 Tankers (Fuel Servicing Trucks) to the latest A4 configuration in support of Combatant Commands (COCOM) requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries and support the European Deterrence Initiative (EDI).  This provisions the European Deterrence Initiative - Army Prepositioned Stock (APS) which supports the establishment of Armored Brigade Combat Teams (ABCT) for EDI. Procurement is necessary to outfit the Pre-Positioned equipment sets. There is no excess inventory or viable substitute available to support the EDI requirement. APS must be filled with trucks that meet armoring requirements. 

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

Gross Weapon System Unit Cost increase from FY 2018 to FY 2019 is caused from an incorrect feed to the FY 2019 PB forms of the FY 2018 quantities. The FY 2018 PB submission is for a quantity of 92, not 106, with a corrected Gross Weapon System Unit Cost of 419.870. Additionally, the hardware unit costs are incorrect in FY 2018 for manufacturing and did not include the additional costs of paint and machine fabrication. Actual unit costs will be updated to reflect corrections in the FY 2020 budget submission. Furthermore, the FY 2019 vehicle is more expensive than the vehicles of the FY 2018 model mix. The price list for this contract contains range pricing and the lower quantities result in higher unit costs. Hardware costs are reflected at the ceiling cost for this Fixed Price Incentive-Firm (FPI-F) contract type to cover any Government portion of any potential cost overruns. FY2019 Total Obligation Authority (TOA) is very low in comparison to the previous two years, however this program still requires the fixed cost of SEPM to support until transitioned to sustainment which contributes to the increase of the Gross Weapon System Unit Cost to 602.719.

Name.val: Hvy Expanded Mobile Tactical Truck Ext Serv

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val: Unit costs are determined by range pricing at ceiling amount for each Ordering Year (OY) and reconciled after the delivery order (DO) is completed. FY 2019 utilizes Order Year Four (OY4) pricing.
